overview.description: Jharkhand, located in eastern India, is known for its rich tribal culture, dense forests, and waterfalls. Established as a state on November 15, 2000, it features attractions like Ranchi and Betla National Park.

top_destinations.name: Ranchi
top_destinations.description: The capital known for waterfalls like Dassam and Hundru.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Jagannath Temple; carry rain gear.

top_destinations.name: Betla National Park
top_destinations.description: A wildlife sanctuary with elephants and tigers.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Book a jeep safari; carry binoculars.

top_destinations.name: Jamshedpur
top_destinations.description: An industrial city with parks like Jubilee Park.

accommodation.name: Van Vihar Resort
accommodation.description: Premium resort near Betla National Park.

culinary_delights.name: Tadka
culinary_delights.description: Famous for North Indian and tribal dishes.

culinary_delights.name: The Brew Estate
culinary_delights.description: Offers a variety of food with a modern vibe.

culinary_delights.name: Sanjha Chulha
culinary_delights.description: Known for local cuisine like litti chokha.

culinary_delights.name: Cafe Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

must_visit_spots.name: Dassam Falls
must_visit_spots.description: A stunning waterfall surrounded by forests.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit after monsoon for the best flow.

must_visit_spots.name: Hundru Falls
must_visit_spots.tip: Carry a camera for scenic shots.

must_visit_spots.name: Baijnath Temple
must_visit_spots.description: An ancient Shiva temple with historical significance.

must_visit_spots.name: Netarhat
must_visit_spots.description: Known as the 'Queen of Chotanagpur' for its sunrise views.

must_visit_spots.name: Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary
must_visit_spots.description: Home to elephants and diverse flora.
must_visit_spots.tip: Plan a guided tour for safety.

must_visit_spots.name: Jubilee Park
must_visit_spots.description: A beautiful park in Jamshedpur with a musical fountain.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit in the evening for the light show.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Ranchi is 1,200 km from Delhi (NH33, 20-22 hrs). By train: Ranchi Junction connects major cities. By air: Birsa Munda Airport (Ranchi).
travel_essentials.tips: Carry light clothing; respect tribal customs.
